Fields.DialogueText: Well, would you look at that. That's quite a necklace you've got on.
Do you like it? It's just a little something I had delivered the last time we made port.
It's amazing. Must've cost a fortune!
Well, I wouldn't be caught dead wearing something cheap.

Fields.MenuText: How expensive was it, exactly?
However much it cost, it was worth it. You look great.
I've never been too big on jewelry, but it doesn't look half bad.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, calm down, Captain. I paid for it myself. Tsh! I'm more responsible than that.
I know, don't I? I saw it and just knew it'd look great with this dress I've had my eye on.
It better not. I paid a small fortune for it. I personally think it looks fantastic.
So I take it you have a taste for the expensive things in life?
I prefer to think of it as a taste for the, ah, finer things in life. They just usually happen to cost a little more.
*ALARM*
I guess that explains why you're no fan of Morganas.
They certainly are NOT one of those finer things.
Which is why they're free and plentiful, I suppose...
@BATTLE
You're still doing this? I didn't actually think you'd still be going through all this effort.
Do you really hate this leather that much?
It's absolutely hideous! But, more importantly, look at the floor I've uncovered.
It's a little grimy, but with some polish I'll have everything looking good as new.

Fields.MenuText: Okay. If it makes you happy.
Knowing you, you'll have it spotless in no time.
What are you doing with all the leather?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, protracted physical labour isn't exactly a joy, but I rather think we'll all love the results.
Well, I'm no maid, but I do know how to make something look good.
Oh, don't worry about that. It's just sitting in storage for now. I assume I'll have to put it all back after.
You know... if you're really going to go through with all this, I guess I could offer some help.
Really? I warn you - it's not going to make me spoil the surprise.
Hmmm... I'll still help. As long as it's not a bad surprise.
*ALARM*
A bad surprise like Morganas?
Yeah, like Morganas. Just tell me we're not going through all this effort for the Morganas' comfort.
Oh, don't worry. Once the crew gets to the guns I'll show you exactly how much I care for the Morganas' comfort.
@BATTLE
Captain, have you noticed anything... odd... about these troops we're transporting?
Odd? What do you mean?
I'm not sure...

Fields.MenuText: Oh, maybe they're actually all dead, and we're transporting ghosts!
Start with broad impressions. What generally seems off? What's worrying you?
If you think something's up, I want to know about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Ghosts, Captain? What are you, five?
Well, it's not that I'm worried, it's just...
They're too... quiet, I guess.
Our previous transport was so rowdy and obnoxious, but these troops are nice and polite, and that hardly makes any sense at all.
Okay, what's the problem? That sounds more like a reason to celebrate.
Why are they so courteous, though? Are these kinds of soldiers more common, or are they the exception to the rule?
Mary, just enjoy it while it lasts. I'm sure the next troops we transport will have their own batch of curiosities.
*ALARM*
And that's our cue to start worrying about something else.
... I suppose you're right. Maybe I just haven't grasped all the oddities of troop transport yet.
@BATTLE
Mary, why are we speeding away from the Morganas?
They're not in our way and we have troops to deliver. There's a lovely battleship group en route to wipe those things up, never you fear.
I thought you were feeling a little more confident these days. We can handle a few Morganas.
I know that... I'm not really scared, I just don't want to take any unnecessary risks.

Fields.MenuText: It's a necessary risk. Every Morgana we destroy is one less Morgana on the seas.
I suppose I understand that. No need to fight every Morgana we see.
You sure you're not just a scaredy cat?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose that... makes sense. Why do you always have to make sense?
Exactly. We'd never get anywhere if we stopped to fight everything along the way.
I'm certainly not. I would just rather get to our destination on time.
You know, I'm just making sure that you're not still worried about dying in battle.
Well... I can't say I don't think about it anymore, but... I'm mostly over it.
*BOOM*
What was that?
Oh, no. It looks like we sped right from one group of Morganas and into another. Of course...
Better sound the alarm. Can't run from every fight, Mary.
*sigh* Clearly.
@BATTLE
We're moving so much faster than I was expecting, Mary. Excellent work.
It's easy when you're me. And when the sea cooperates with you. On beautiful days like this it reminds me why sea travel is the superior form of transportation.
What about air travel?
Psh! Passing fad. Ocean liners will always be the best choice for international travel. I mean, look at this view! You're not going to get this up in the clouds.

Fields.MenuText: I agree. There's just something pleasant about sailing the seas.
Air travel is just faster. Speed over comfort.
They both have their strengths and weaknesses.

Fields.DialogueText: That's my captain. You've got your head screwed on straight.
Fine, you take your planes and get there fast. Just don't come whining to me when you skid off a runway and plow into the side of someone's barn.
That's no choice at all. You need to learn to choose a side, Captain.
*ALARM*
Damn, and we were moving so fast too.
I suppose I better slow us down. Unless you'd like to try and sail right past them?
I'm sure you could do it, but not this time, Mary.
I didn't think so.
@BATTLE
That's unexpectedly vivid.
I do like to put in the work.
Hey, Mary, I've been meaning to ask for a while now about that ribbon you're always wearing.
Oh, you mean this? It's the Blue Riband. It's awarded to the passenger liner with the highest record speed. Namely, moi.
So that's why you're so proud of your speed.
Well, of course! I believe earned the right to boast a little.

Fields.MenuText: Is that really such a big deal? I've never heard of it.
Sounds pretty important. I understand why you wear it around all the time.
I have to say, it looks pretty good on you. I think it brings out your eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a huge deal. There's a trophy and everything.
Exactly. If I could wear the trophy around all the time too, I would. But it's a little big for a proper accessory.
Oh, stop, you'll make a lady blush with that sweet talk. If you think this looks good, wait until you see the trophy.
There's a trophy too?
There wasn't always, but there is now. And now it's mine. And it's going to stay that way this time.
Sounds like there's a story there. I didn't realize you were so competitive.
I don't want to talk about it. I can get ruthless. And that's just an ugly colour on me.
It's hard to imagine you as ugly, Mary.
*ALARM*
You flatterer. That's easy to say when you're always fighting these hideous beasts.
Morganas or not, I just can't imagine you as anything other than stunning.
All right, now I'm blushing. Can we please focus on the Morganas before I get completely red?
@BATTLE
We'll be reaching our destination shortly, Captain. Then we can unload these troops.
Are you okay, Mary? You don't sound happy about that.
Transporting these troops has been... well, really rather delightful. It's felt sort of like a vacation back into normality.
I didn't realize you were getting so worn out.
Can you blame me? I wasn't built for this kind of life. I was built for pleasure cruises. It's a bit of a strain. I could use a pleasure cruise myself, right about now.

Fields.MenuText: I wish we had time for a vacation, but, you know, war and all that.
I'll see what I can do to get us some down time. I'm sure you're not the only one who could use a break.
Please don't tempt me. I've been known to fantasize about "navigational problems" in the Caribbean from time to time.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. War this, war that. I really hate war. It ruins everything.
You'd do that for me? I mean, you don't have to, I'm the Belle here. I'm supposed to be taking care of you and the rest of the crew.
Could we?
For now, focus on the fact that this assignment will be over before you know it.
I'll try. It's hard for me to not think ahead sometimes. I like to keep things organized. Parties, my closet, future plans, stuff like that.
Well, sometimes life can be messy.
Yes, I'm starting to realize that. Nothing's quite so messy.
*ALARM*
Speaking of mess, what do you say we make a mess out of some Morganas?
You know, it's hard to be afraid when you act so confident about winning, Captain.
Then I'll keep being confident. So let's defeat these guys and have one more reason for our confidence.
@BATTLE
And as your captain, it's my job to take care of you.
Probably not without me getting court-martialled at the end.
Would they let you stay in my brig?
Probably not.
Well, then, I suppose I can't approve.
There, that's the last of it. That took a lot more time than I thought it would take.
They weren't messing around with that ugly leather, but it took a lot less time to remove with your help.
Thank you, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: It was the least I could do.
I couldn't just stand by and watch a lovely lady in need, now could I?
Just don't tell anyone that I helped you partially dismantle the ship. I am the captain, after all.

Fields.DialogueText: And so modest too. You truly are a fine officer, Captain.
Well, no, you're altogether better than that. Though, don't get me wrong, I could've done it myself.
I... Technically you're not wrong, but... it was a hideous nuisance. Your secret is safe with me.
So now will you tell me what you're planning for this room?
Well, I suppose now is as good a time as any. I do need your help, actually.
What do you need me to do?
I'd like to throw a little party on board, Captain. Or, really, a gala of sorts.
And you need my help with that? I thought you loved planning parties and the like.
*ALARM*
Oh, how do Morganas always know the worst time to show up? I'm afraid we'll have to finish this conversation later, Captain.
You're not going to try and get me to run again?
No. These ones made the mistake of interrupting me!
@BATTLE
Captain, you rang?
I figured we could continue our conversation. I still need to know more about this party you're throwing. You said you needed my help?
Well... to be more accurate, what I'm planning is much larger than a simple party. It's going to be a gala of some sort.
Okay, but... what do you need my help with? That's kind of where I'm confused, Mary.
Well. There's been rumbling in diplomatic channels for the past several weeks about the need for a kind of mini-summit. An opportunity to update some of the Zurich protocols.
Right. They've been trying to schedule this for weeks, but nobody can agree on a location.
And that's where we come in! I want The Queen Mary to be the location for this event.

Fields.MenuText: It's not really a party situation. It's an important diplomatic meeting.
That... doesn't sound like the worst plan. It could be considered a more neutral location. We're not a warship.
I hope you have a Plan B, because I don't see that happening.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I understand that, but important people have important friends, and maybe if this meeting didn't sound so dreadful they'd be more likely to actually show up.
My thinking exactly. Besides, who would miss out on the chance to attend a gala on The Queen Mary? My soirees were practically famous before the war started.
Oh don't be such a stick in the mud. This could totally work. I mean, it couldn't hurt to ask.
I can handle the party preparations on my own, what I need you to do is find out if our superiors would even go for it.
I'll do what I can, but I can't make any promises. We'll have to wait and see what happens.
Perfect, Captain. This is going to be brilliant!
@BATTLE
Captain, have you heard about this insanity going on with the other Belles?
What are you talking about, Mary? If Belles were going insane, I think I'd have heard about it.
Well, maybe they're not going insane, but they're acting rather foolish. I've heard of a few Belles that have started some competition. See which Belle can defeat the most Morganas and all that.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, that doesn't sound insane at all. There's nothing wrong with a little healthy competition.
That is crazy. This isn't the time for some weird contest. This is war.
Really? How many Belles are getting in on this?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose not. A little competition can fuel the fires that could very well turn the tide of this war in our favor.
Exactly. And this competition could very easily get in the way of my plans. I don't want that to happen.
I'm not sure, honestly. I'd like to believe that the majority of Belles see this as childish, like myself.
*ALARM*
Eeeek! Dammit, again. It always catches me off guard.
You're still so jumpy. I thought you weren't worried about dying anymore.
I... I'm not as scared of constantly facing death on the battlefield... I'm just not eager on shaking its hand every day.
I understand, but I hope you believe me when I say I'm here to protect you. You're not dying on my watch.
That does help, Captain. Thanks. Now let's go. Let's get this over with.
Hm. A competition to defeat Morganas? I wonder...
@BATTLE
Mary, I was hoping to talk to you about something.
Oh? I this about my gala?! Oh my, did we get the go-ahead?
No, not really. This is more about that Morgana-defeating competition you mentioned earlier. I was thinking it might be a good idea to enter you in it.
What? Why?

Fields.MenuText: It sounds like fun.
Well, you talked about that ruthless side of you. I was hoping to see it firsthand.
I was thinking it might help you get over your fears.

Fields.DialogueText: Fun for you, maybe. I'm not exactly built for competitions like this.
Why would you want to see that? It's a hideous side of me I'd rather no one ever see!
I'm not... Okay... I suppose that makes a little sense, but... I'm still just not sure.
We don't have to do anything, I was just thinking it could be a good idea. You'd be able to work on your fears a little, and maybe win a trophy or something.
... There's a trophy?
I'm not actually sure. I'm sure the winner will get some kind of prize.
... If we're going to do this... You have to make sure I don't get too out of control. I don't want to ruin the way the crew sees me.
You'll always be our Belle. I don't think there's anything you can do to change that.
Well... I hope you keep saying that when all I care about is how many Morganas I've defeated. I hope this doesn't turn into the Blue Riband all over again. That was ugly.
@BATTLE
We've got a whole bunch of Morganas approaching us. It might actually be a smart move to run this time, Mary.
Oh, please, we'll be running all right. Running circles around those idiotic beasts that think they can make us their prey.
Whoa, Mary, I never thought I'd hear something like that out of you.
Hold my earrings, Captain. Actually, my shoes too. This is gonna get messy as all hell!
@BATTLE
Mary, that was... impressive. To say the least.
Ahem, excuse me... I never meant for you to see that side of me.

Fields.MenuText: It was a little scary, but effective.
You scared the hell out of me, but you obliterated  those Morganas!
I've seen a hell of a lot worse than that.

Fields.DialogueText: A little scary? I feel like you're being kind.
Yes, but at what cost? I'm worried you'll never look at me the same way again.
I doubt that. I'm almost as bad as those Morganas when my blood starts pumping like that.
See? This is what I was afraid of... And this is only the start of it.
Is it wrong to say that I find myself oddly attracted to you right now?
I'm not sure whether to blush or be insulted... Hey, wait! We need to make sure to tally those Morganas before we forget!
Look at them go, Captain. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised that they're not running all over themselves to get off the ship like the previous troops.
It makes sense. They were pretty courteous throughout the entire voyage.
Hmmm... I'm going to miss them. I'm not looking forward to whatever brutes we pick up next.
You don't know, they could be even more pleasant.
I won't get my hopes up.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, that's probably smart.
Keep hope. It's important.
Well, I'll keep my fingers crossed anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: And I try to be as intelligent as I can.
Okay, fine, I'll keep a little hope. But only for you.
Is that supposed to do something? I don't feel any different.
*ALARM*
Morganas? Get these troops off the ship. I've got some points to score.
Yeah... I still find it kind of attractive. There may be something wrong with me...
@BATTLE
All right, Captain.
Yes...?
Where are we heading to get our next batch of troops for transport?

Fields.MenuText: You're that eager for a new assignment?
I don't know. What are you looking at me for?
Could you be any less enthusiastic?

Fields.DialogueText: No. I'd just really rather get it over with.
Huff! You're the captain. You're supposed to know these things.
If you want me to be more enthusiastic, give me a more enticing assignment. You know the one I have in mind.
So where are we going? Seriously.
Actually, we're not going too far. It seems like our transports are being held for the moment.
What? Why? Were they unhappy with my performance? No, that couldn't be it.
Well, it seems like they want to give us enough time to prepare for this gala of yours. They're expecting quite a bit out of you.
Wait... are you saying what I think you're saying?
All sides agreed to hold this little meeting here. The Queen Mary is getting dressed to the nines again.
This is going to be the greatest event ever! It's going to be glorious. I can scarcely wait!
Well, it's still just a boring diplomatic gathering. How exciting can it be?
You leave that to me.
@BATTLE
Enemy inbound! Full speed ahead!
@BATTLE
I didn't expect Morganas to attack us in port like that.

Fields.MenuText: Neither did I. I guess they're just tricky like that.
You have to expect Morganas around every corner. They could be anywhere at any time!
Can't you sense them though?

Fields.DialogueText: Tricky, sneaky, evil... They're despicable.
Well... Not anywhere. I mean, I doubt they'll be showing up in my closet anytime soon.
Well... It's not infallible. I'm not exactly that good at it, if I'm being honest.
I guess it's just lucky that we were here.
Maybe we should go after some more. My score could use a good boost.
So bloodthirsty. I thought you were just complaining about needing a vacation.
That was before I saw the scores. We are just this close to first place. A few more attacks like this and we'll be bringing home the gold, Captain.
But let's not hope for Morgana attacks. At least for the sake of the innocent civilians.
... Well, I mean obviously. I'd never wish for... Argh, you know what I meant!
It's come a long way, don't you think? It's looking much more elegant than that leather-covered mess hall, right?
I almost don't recognize it. It's hard to believe.
I'm sensing there's something you're not quite saying there, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm saying everything there is to say. You've done a wonderful job, Mary.
It's just... I kind of liked the leather. It was comfy.
I just hope all this effort we went through is worth it for one party.

Fields.DialogueText: You mean we've done a wonderful job. You've been with me through every step of the way.
You liked that dreadful leather? Well, there's about a mountain of it in storage. You can go to town on it!
You'll see. We may be exhausted by the time we're actually finished, but it'll be glorious.
Let's see... we have the tables ready, the floors are shining... Oh, we need a chandelier!
A chandelier? Huh, I guess I can see how that might improve the ambience.
Exactly! I'm so glad you understand. They're the absolute picture of elegance. We simply must have one.
We'll have to keep our eyes out next time we make port.
Remember, price is no object. The more expensive the better, even!
*ALARM*
That sounds like something we can discuss more after the battle.
Really? Because I'm pretty sure it's already been decided.
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain, it's about time for another patrol, don't you think? We've got to keep those numbers up!
How are the scores? Are we in the lead yet?
Not exactly... I don't know how those bloody aircraft carriers are defeating so many Morganas, but we're going to have to work double time to try and catch up to them.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the other Belles are just in more populated waters.
Sounds like we're not trying hard enough. We might have to go all the way to triple the effort.
Hey, haven't you ever heard that slow and steady wins the race?

Fields.DialogueText: Great, and we're stuck in one place getting ready for the gala. I guess you can't win every fight...
With that kind of attitude we'll lock this contest right down, Captain.
That's ridiculous. I've never been slow at anything. I'm not starting now.
Now that I think about it, it might help if we upgrade our arsenal.
Hmmmm... if we boosted our firepower we'd most likely have to make sacrifices in other departments... Not worth it.
Sometimes you've got to make sacrifices and compromises to get that gold.
Extra firepower can only do so much. We've still got to find the Morganas.
Yeah, I get it. Let's go on patrol.
Let's clear out all the Morganas we can find!
@BATTLE
Mary, I just learned we changed our course. Where are we going?
We're going to hunt Morganas. More Morganas.
We're heading out a little farther than usual.
Well, there aren't any Morganas left near port. I guess we scared them all off. I'm not going to let a bunch of scared Morganas cost me this competition.
But that doesn't explai--
Excuse me, I didn't finish speaking.
... Go on?
Well, there might not be many Morganas around the port, but I was hearing rumors about a huge swarm of the things attacking another port. So that's where we're headed now.

Fields.MenuText: It sounds like you're just looking for a fight now, Mary.
Hmmm, I like what you're saying, Mary. Lead the way.
A swarm? I really don't like the sound of that.

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly what I'm doing. It's what I've got to do. I'm not going to win by sitting around and waiting for the Morganas to come to me.
I'm glad you're on board with the plan, Captain, because it's a little late to turn back now.
Oh, I know what you mean. It makes it sound like a bunch of bugs. I hate bugs. But don't worry, I think they're just normal everyday Morganas.
*ALARM*
Sounds like we're getting close to that swarm now.
It doesn't look that bad.
We're still a ways off. There's a lot more than it looks like.
And you're sure we can handle this?
There's only one way to find out.
@BATTLE
Mary? Hello? Anyone home?
Oh, Captain? I'm, er, sorry. I was just sort of daydreaming about the party.
I could see that. You were kind of dancing in place. I still need your help getting everything set up.
I know, don't worry. We're running way ahead of schedule. It's fine to take some time to daydream a little.
What exactly are you daydreaming about?
Just silliness. I mean... there's no chance that a flock of celebrities will be attending, is there?

Fields.MenuText: Celebrities? Uh, no. It's not going to be that kind of party. It's going to be diplomats muttering in dark corners.
Maybe? I mean... I don't know. I don't have a lot of experience with celebrities.
A flock? Is that really what a group of celebrities is called? I would've guessed it'd be a pride.

Fields.DialogueText: You keep saying that... I'm going to prove you wrong. This is going to be the party of the year. That way all the celebrities will want to come to the next one.
Yeah, good point. You're probably not the best person to ask...
Ha! That works too, and in fact, it works a little better. I might borrow that.
I suppose if I wanted celebrities to show up, we should've been docked in California. One day.
Mary, if you keep daydreaming about celebrities, I'm going to start getting a little jealous.
Jealous? Why would you be jealous?
*ALARM*
*CRASH*
Oh, those damn Morganas. I broke a plate. I hope we have extras.
We can worry about that later. For now, let's make these Morganas pay for that broken plate. It's vintage!
@BATTLE
Well...?
Well, that's that.
The contest is over. The winner has been decided.

Fields.MenuText: And that winner is?
Tell me we won. We destroyed so many Morganas!
Already? I thought we had more time.

Fields.DialogueText: Not Queen Mary. We worked so hard, I was so ruthless... but we weren't even close in the end.
I know we did! Some other Belle must've been destroying fleets of the bastards!
Maybe if we had more time we would've managed to win. But as it stands, we're just shy of placing.
We didn't even make the top five! Ah, how pathetic is that...
Hey, look on the bright side. You're pretty much the opposite of scared of Morganas now. You were hunting after them!
Hmmm, you're right. I haven't been afraid at all. I can't believe this stupid plan of yours worked.
Hey, if it was really stupid, it wouldn't have worked.
I suppose you have a point. Plus, we'll certainly win the next contest. We came this close.
Oh, this is going to be a thing now? You're going to start running after fights?
I'm a Belle, aren't I?
Yeah, but you're also a troop transport. Not a one-woman army.
*ALARM*
Well, let's see if I can't prove that statement wrong.
I guess this is better than you being too afraid to fight.
@BATTLE
You know, now that the competition is over, I guess we can start focusing more on this party, right?
That implies that I haven't already been spending a good deal of my time there. I've even spent entire nights making sure everything was on track.
Whole nights? I thought I was helping so you wouldn't have to do stuff like that.
Well, everything at this point really needs my personal attention... My flair, if you will. All I really need you to focus on is making sure you're dressed up and pretty for the event.
Dressed up? I can't just wear this?
Oh, lord, no. You need to wear something elegant; something you wouldn't normally wear. Something you'll probably never wear again. I could show you what I'm wearing if you need an example.

Fields.MenuText: It's times like this that I wish I could just wear a burlap sack. It's easier that way.
You know, an example might be a good idea. Then I'll have somewhere to start from.
I think I've got something I could put on. It's pretty fancy.

Fields.DialogueText: No! Don't even joke about that! You obviously can not wear a garbage bag. I will not allow a... a... VAGRANT into my gala, captain or not. You're going to wear something phenomenal if it kills me!
Excellent. I'm actually curious as well to get your opinion on my outfit. I'm not quite sure it's dazzling enough.
Fancy? Is that the best you can do? Clearly this is where I step in to help, yes?
*ALARM*
Oh, great. More Morganas.
Our outfits will have to wait until after we knock them down a peg or two.
We don't really have to worry too much about what we're wearing do we? They're just clothes, right?
... I'm going to pretend I didn't just hear you say that. Or else I might become distracted from the Morganas and start attacking you.
@BATTLE
Okay, how does this one look?
No... no, it's just not right. Go back in and try the other one. I think it'll fit better actually.
What do you mean fit better...?
Just trust me, okay?
Okay, okay. You know I trust you... right?
Well, I was hoping it wasn't one sided. I feel like we've certainly earned each other's trust and admiration. I mean, I have a lot to thank you for, actually.
Really? What do you need to thank me for? You've been doing all the hard work here.
Are you kidding? Without your help I'd still be a scared little mess when it came to Morganas. Plus you've been with me every step of the way with the dining room.
Why, we wouldn't even be throwing this gala if it wasn't for you.
Well, putting it like that, you're going to make me blush.
Well, get your blushing face out here and let me see how you look.
Oh, I was definitely right. That looks a lot better, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: You were right. This one feels a lot better on me. It's nice and soft.
You sure? It feels a little stiff.
Eh, if you say so. I just think clothes are clothes.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh, who cares how it feels? It's how it looks that matters, and it looks great!
Well, I guess you could go with the other one, but this one definitely looks better.
Fine, you can think that all you want. As long as you let me keep dressing you up nice.
Wearing something like that, you definitely look dashing enough to be my escort to the party.
Your escort? Like your date?
Well, yes. It's only appropriate for a lady to arrive at her party with an escort. I suppose I only assumed you'd act as mine.
Well... I guess I'm your date then.
Yes, well, okay, but wipe that smile off your face. We've got a patrol to run, and I doubt the Morganas will be afraid of a captain with a dopey smile!
@BATTLE
Well, I'm pretty sure we're not going to have any issues with Morganas attacking during the party.
I guess that was another upside of that competition. We've already wiped out a lot of the little monsters.

Fields.MenuText: But not all of them. There are always more Morganas.
A lot? I stopped counting how many Morganas we've destroyed. Feels like hundreds!
I kind of miss all the Morganas popping up at inconvenient times.

Fields.DialogueText: Not for lack of trying on our part.
There weren't that many. I was keeping track, remember?
Really? You'd rather have Morganas pop up than finish a conversation with me? Hmph. You sure know how to make a lady feel special!
So, onto more pleasant conversation. Are you ready for the party?
You mean, am I ready to escort you to the party? I'm looking forward to it.
Brilliant. If you do a good enough job, we may have to do this again sometime soon.
*ALARM*
What? More Morganas? What rock were these ones hiding under?
Doesn't matter. We'll chase them off like all the rest.
@BATTLE
I have to say, Captain, you're excellent company.
You don't say?
I have a feeling that some of these conversations would be just dreadfully boring without you on my arm.

Fields.MenuText: I told you, it's a bunch of fuddy-duddy diplomats and politicians. They're not exactly known for their charisma.
You're not so bad yourself. It's a great party, but I'm pretty sure it'd be nothing without you.
I don't feel like I'm doing much. But I guess I'm doing it well, at least.

Fields.DialogueText: Charismatic or not, they're still my guest and I still feel like I need to make a good impression.
Well, now you're just trying to make me blush. Though I guess you have a point. This party wouldn't even be without me.
You're doing plenty. Just stand next to me and look pretty.
You know, this is a great party and all, but I haven't been able to shake this one thought all night. So... I've been thinking... is this, like, a date?
Maybe. I mean, I wouldn't be opposed to it. Do you think you could handle dating a woman like me?
I think I'd be up for the challenge.
Well, if this is a date, then you know how it's going to end, right? With a kiss.
A kiss? I--
What did you just say? How dare you speak to me like that?!
I'll speak to you any way I like. I have a long memory and I know how to hold a grudge!
Oh, hold that thought, Captain. It sounds like I'm needed to break up another argument. Why don't you go get us something to drink?
I told you it wasn't a normal party situation, didn't I?
I like to think the party's helping a little.
So... I'm supposed to kiss her at the end of the night, huh?
Hooray for diplomacy!
So how are you doing, Captain? Your feet killing you from working the room? Mine certainly are!
Well, I was smart enough to not wear heels. I gotta say, though, I definitely need a rest.
Hey, if your feet aren't killing you by the end of a party, you weren't doing it right. You've got to make sure to make a meaningful memory with each of your guests.

Fields.MenuText: You and I have very different ways of partying.
That's an interesting way to think about it. Is that how you make a lasting impression?
If you make a meaningful memory with everyone, then are any of them really meaningful?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you prefer to sit in a corner and eat all the food? Well, I'm glad you behaved better this time. You were perfectly genteel!
Yes, and it's also how you make connections. The trick is to make people remember your name. It works in business and in politics.
Don't get all philosophical on me. I could argue all day with you, but I'm already exhausted.
It was a good party. Think their ''meeting'' went as well as the festivities?
Actually, I helped moderate quite a few talks. There was some harsh language here and there, but overall I think everyone got what they needed.
That's good to hear. I'm glad I wasn't the only one whose night ended well.
Well, the night hasn't ended yet.
No. No, it hasn't...
Oh, Captain. If you get so close to me like that, I might get the wrong idea.
Or the right one.
That was... Ah... We'll have to do this again sometime soon.
The kiss... or the party?
Why not both?
You can throw all the parties that you want.
I'm going to hold you to that, Captain.
Hey... so what does this make us? I mean, I'm not just your captain anymore. Not if we're doing stuff like this.
Well, you are my captain, but if it's not obvious... I care about you. I have feelings for you.
Clearly I feel the same way.
*ALARM*
How are there still Morganas!?
They just love ruining the mood.
How about we ruin theirs, then? And after that, we can get back to this...
@BATTLE
